screenModel module¶

  • University of Stavanger

  • Hui Cheng (PhD student)

  • Lin Li (Medveileder)

  • Prof. Muk Chen Ong (Supervisor)

Any questions about this code, please email: hui.cheng@uis.no

Modules can be used to calculate the hydrodynamic forces on nets. In order to use this module, we recommend import screenModel as sm in the beginning of your code. Please refer to Cheng et al. (2020) [https://doi.org/10.1016/j.aquaeng.2020.102070] for details.

screenModel.calculation_on_element(point1, point2, point3, velocity)¶

Moudule private function.

Parameters

  • point1 – point1 [np.array].shape=(1,3) or a [list] of coordinates Unit: [m].

  • point2 – point2 [np.array].shape=(1,3) or a [list] of coordinates Unit: [m].

  • point3 – point3 [np.array].shape=(1,3) or a [list] of coordinates Unit: [m].

  • velocity – [np.array].shape=(1,3) Unit: [m/s]. Flow velocity

Returns

inflow angle [float][rad], lift vector[np.array].shape=(1,3) [-], area of net panel [float][m^2]

screenModel.convert_hydro_element(elements)¶
Parameters

elements – [[list]] Unit: [-]. A list of indexes of elements which can contain 4 or 3 nodes.

Returns

[[list]] Unit: [-]. A list of indexes of elements only contain 3 nodes.

class screenModel.forceModel(model_index, hydro_element, solidity, dwh=0.0, dw0=0.0)¶

Bases: object

For Morison hydrodynamic models, the forces on netting are calculated based on individual a panel section of netting. The twines and knots in the net panel are considered as an integrated structure. In this module, the net panel is defined by three nodes because three (non-colinear) points can determine a unique plane in Euclidean geometry. In practice, the force is usually decomposed into two componnets: drag force F_D and lift force F_L (Cheng et al., 2020).

Parameters

  • model_index – [string] Unit: [-]. To indicate the model function, e.g.: ‘S1’, ‘S2’, ‘S3’.

  • hydro_element – [[list]] Unit: [-]. A python list to indicate how the net panel are connected. e.g.:[[p1,p2,p3][p2,p3,p4,p5]…]. If the input net panel contains 4 nodes, it will automaticly decomposed to 3 node net panel.

  • solidity – [float] Unit: [-]. The solidity of netting.

  • dwh – [float] Unit: [m]. The hydrodynamic diameter of the numerical net twines. It is used for the force calculation (reference area)

  • dw0 – [float] Unit: [m]. The diameter of the physical net twines. It is used for the hydrodynamic coefficients.

distribute_force(number_of_node)¶

Transfer the forces on line element to their corresponding nodes.

Returns

[np.array].shape=(N,3) Unit [N]. The hydrodynamic forces on all N nodes.

force_on_element(net_wake, realtime_node_position, current_velocity, wave=False, fe_time=0)¶
Parameters

  • net_wake – A object wake model, net2net wake model. Must create first.

  • realtime_node_position – [np.array].shape=(N,3) Unit: [m]. The coordinates of N nodes in cartesian coordinate system.

  • current_velocity – [np.array].shape=(1,3) Unit [m/s]. The current velocity [ux,uy,uz] in cartesian coordinate system.

  • wave – A wake model object. Default value=False Must create first.

  • fe_time – [float] Unit [s]. The time in Code_Aster. Default value=0 Must give if wave is added.

  • current_velocity – numpy array ([ux,uy,uz]), Unit [m/s]

Returns

[np.array].shape=(M,3) Unit [N]. The hydrodynamic forces on all M elements. Meanwhile, update the self.hydroForces_Element

hydro_coefficients(inflow_angle, current_velocity, knot=False)¶
Returns

Parameters

  • inflow_angle – [float] Unit [rad]. Definition: the angle between normal vector of a net panel and the flow direction

  • current_velocity – [np.array].shape=(1,3) Unit: [m/s]. The current velocity [ux,uy,uz] in cartesian coordinate system.

  • knot – [boolean] knot option. Default=False

Returns

drag and lift force coefficients. [float] Unit: [-].

output_hydro_element()¶
Returns

[[list]] of the indexes of points in elements. e.g.:[[1,2,3],[2,3,4]…]

screen_fsi(realtime_node_position, velocity_on_element, velocity_of_nodes=array([0, 0, 0]))¶
Parameters

  • realtime_node_position – [np.array].shape=(N,3) Unit: [m]. The coordinates of N nodes in cartesian coordinate system.

  • velocity_on_element – [np.array].shape=(M,3) Unit [m/s]. The current velocity [ux,uy,uz] on all net panels in cartesian coordinate system.

  • velocity_of_nodes – [np.array].shape=(N,3) Unit: [m/s]. The velocities of N nodes in cartesian coordinate system.

Returns

update the self.hydroForces_Element and output the forces on all the net panels.

Module private function.

  • p2 – point2 [np.array].shape=(1,3) or a [list] of coordinates Unit: [m].

Returns

The distance between two points. [float] Unit [m].

Module private function.

  • p2 – point2 [np.array].shape=(1,3) or a [list] of coordinates Unit: [m].
